Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead without stopping
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: If you are going straight through a roundabout don’t signal as you come up to the roundabout, only signal left as you pass the exit before the one you wish to take.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: What must you do when you see 2 red lights flashing outside a fire station?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and drive on carefully if the way is clear
Slow down and stop if any other vehicle is coming
Slow down to 20km/h
Stop until the lights stop flashing

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

No

Question: What does the legal definition of a road include?

Answers.Answer: Streets and motorways
Bridges and car parks
Beaches
All of the above

Question: A vehicle should not send out visible smoke for more than how many seconds?

Answers.Answer: 3 seconds
5 seconds
8 seconds
10 seconds

Question: You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: You wish to turn left at the intersection. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Speed up and turn in front of the cyclist
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stay back until the cyclist has passed the intersection
Keep driving to the next intersection

Question: What should you do if you meet animals coming towards you on the road?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and move over to the left side of the road
Give a long blast with the horn on your vehicle
Give a lot of short toots with the horn on your vehicle
Race your vehicle engine

Question: What does this traffic signal mean?

Answers.Answer: Drive on before the signal changes to red
Drive on because the signal will turn green
Stop if you can do so safely
Stop only if traffic is in the way

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: The warrant of fitness label for your car should be displayed at the:

Answers.Answer: top centre of the windscreen
left of the windscreen
top right corner of the windscreen
bottom centre of the windscreen

Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

No

The parents of the passengers
You as the driver of the vehicle
Other passengers in your vehicle
